about_section.title: The Divine Creator of the Universe
about_section.description: Brahma is the source of all creation, bringing the universe into existence from the cosmic lotus emerging from Vishnu's navel.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the god of creation, Brahma shaped the cosmos, the elements, and all living beings, imparting wisdom and knowledge to humanity.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Though revered, Brahma has few temples due to his role being complete, while worship is primarily directed to Vishnu and Shiva.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Brahma works alongside Vishnu and Shiva, yet is sometimes challenged by forces of disorder seeking to unmake creation.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Vedas** contain the divine knowledge of the universe, the **Lotus of Creation** symbolizes his role as the origin of existence, and the **Mantras of Existence** sustain cosmic balance.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Brahma granted divine wisdom to sages and taught humanity the sacred scriptures, shaping Hindu philosophy and thought.

name: Vishnu
title: The Preserver, Guardian of the Cosmic Order

about_section.title: The Divine Preserver of the Universe
about_section.description: Vishnu upholds dharma and cosmic balance, intervening whenever the forces of chaos and destruction threaten the world.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: He takes multiple avatars, such as Rama and Krishna, to restore righteousness, ensuring the universe remains in harmony.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Vishnu is one of the most widely worshipped deities, with millions of followers dedicated to his devotion through Vaishnavism.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: He collaborates with Brahma and Shiva in the cosmic cycle of creation, sustenance, and destruction, while opposing demonic beings who seek to disrupt dharma.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: His **Sudarshana Chakra** represents divine justice, the **Eternal Conch** signals cosmic balance, and the **Cosmic Serpent (Ananta Shesha)** supports the universe.

name: Shiva
title: The Destroyer, The Transformer, The Supreme Yogi

about_section.title: The Cosmic Force of Destruction and Renewal
about_section.description: Shiva is responsible for dissolving the universe in order for it to be reborn, representing both destruction and transformation.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the Supreme Yogi, he embodies divine detachment, meditation, and enlightenment, guiding spiritual seekers.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Shiva is one of the most revered deities, with Shaivism being a major tradition in Hinduism. His devotees seek liberation (moksha) through devotion and asceticism.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Though he works with Vishnu and Brahma to maintain cosmic balance, Shivaâ€™s destructive nature often clashes with forces that resist change.

about_section.description: The **Trident (Trishul)** symbolizes his threefold power, the **Damaru** produces the cosmic vibrations of creation, and the **Serpent Vasuki** represents the conquest of fear.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Shiva appears to mortals in many forms, granting boons, testing devotion, and leading seekers towards enlightenment.

about_section.title: The Goddess of Wealth and Fortune
about_section.description: Lakshmi is the divine source of prosperity, blessing her devotees with abundance, success, and happiness.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As the eternal consort of Vishnu, she ensures balance in material and spiritual wealth, guiding devotees toward prosperity.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Lakshmi is worshipped in homes and temples, especially during **Diwali**, where devotees seek her blessings for wealth and well-being.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: She stands alongside Vishnu, Ganesha, and Saraswati, while opposing forces that spread poverty, greed, and ignorance.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Lotus of Purity** symbolizes spiritual and material prosperity, the **Shower of Gold Coins** represents abundance, and the **Mantra of Prosperity** brings divine fortune.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Lakshmi is revered as the giver of good fortune, and her blessings are sought for financial stability, success, and family harmony.

name: Durga
title: The Fierce Warrior Goddess, Vanquisher of Evil

about_section.title: The Divine Warrior and Guardian of Dharma
about_section.description: Durga is the supreme goddess of power and protection, created by the gods to eliminate the forces of evil.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: Armed with celestial weapons and divine strength, Durga vanquishes demons and safeguards the universe from chaos.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Durga is widely worshipped during **Navratri**, where devotees celebrate her victory over evil and seek her blessings for courage and protection.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Durga stands alongside the Devas, yet her fiercest battle was against **Mahishasura**, the shape-shifting demon king.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: The **Sword of Justice** symbolizes her duty to uphold righteousness, the **Trident of Power** is her divine weapon, and the **Lion Mount** represents her fearlessness.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Durga is invoked in times of crisis, granting strength and wisdom to those who seek her aid against injustice and oppression.

name: Krishna
title: The Divine Hero, The Supreme Avatar of Vishnu

about_section.title: The Divine Hero and Supreme Guide
about_section.description: Krishna is the eighth avatar of Vishnu, embodying divine love, wisdom, and heroism. He plays a crucial role in guiding the world towards dharma.

about_section.title: Mythological Power & Influence
about_section.description: As a divine strategist and warrior, Krishna helped shape the Mahabharata's epic events and imparted spiritual wisdom in the **Bhagavad Gita**.

about_section.title: Worship & Cultural Impact
about_section.description: Krishna is adored as a **child prankster**, a **romantic flute-player**, and the **Supreme Being** by Vaishnavites worldwide, especially during **Janmashtami**.

about_section.title: Allies & Rivalries
about_section.description: Krishna aided the Pandavas in their quest for justice, yet he also faced treacherous foes like **Kamsa, Shishupala, and Duryodhana**.

about_section.title: Artifacts & Symbols of Power
about_section.description: His **Flute of Enchantment** symbolizes divine love and harmony, the **Bhagavad Gita** embodies his spiritual teachings, and the **Sudarshana Chakra** wields cosmic justice.

about_section.title: Mortal Encounters & Legacy
about_section.description: Krishna's presence transformed the lives of those around him, leading humanity towards **devotion (bhakti), wisdom, and righteousness.**
